description.narrative: Improved capacity for decentralized planning and monitoring for results in basic education.

mailing-address.narrative: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of training of other education staff excluding teachers (e.g. inspectors, district, ministry staff, etc.)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: Ghana United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Ghana Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Education)
Ghana Country Programme Document 2012-2016 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 Ghana: Evaluation Report of the UNICEF Ghana Education Programme (2012–2017): A Capacity Building Perspective
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved capacity for decentralized planning and monitoring for results in basic education.

description.narrative: GES structure development and validation completed; SOPs to strengthen regional education offices initiated; national planning templates underway; mobile school report card (mSRC) identified to form accountability framework. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/07/2020

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides data on attendance and dropout - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Emergency preparedness - Comprehensive and updated risk assessment of the education sector - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - National strategies address inequities in education resource allocation - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Emergency preparedness - Availability of a risk reduction strategy within the Education Sector Plan/Policy - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Existence of national strategies to address inequities in education access, participation and retention - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - EMIS - EMIS that provides disaggregated data, including income/assets, disability and school physical environment - score (1-4), see guidance
Proportion (number) of schools in focus district routinely submitting data and generating termly (3) mSRC-based school report cards annually

Service Delivery - Communities - School management committees (or parent teacher association or school communities or similar structure) whose capacity was developed through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
Districts have the tools and capacity to support and monitor the "functionality" of School Management Committees (SMCs) and Parents Teachers Associations (PTAs)

actual.value: 2019:DEOCs strengthens relationship with 2000 PTA/SMCs in 20 focus districts and yet to initiate harmonization of tools to monitor their functionality.

title.narrative: Availability of a capacity-building strategy and tools for decentralized planning/monitoring in education
